description.narrative: The project's development objective is to establish a sustainable program for expanding access to electricity in rural communities, thus supporting broad-based economic development and helping alleviate poverty. The objective of the UEAP is to significantly expand access to electricity in rural towns and villages.

condition.narrative: Borrower to prepare an integrated plan for grid and off-grid electrification of rural towns and otehr rural areas.
Borrower will contribute funding (including the proceeds of the IDA Credit) to EEPCo for not less than 80% of the capital coss ofth e Proejct and of the UEAP.
EEPCo to ensure that ongoing operating expenses and investments to be financed from revenues (other than from grants, equitycontrib utions and other similar sources) do not exceed available revenues.
EEPCo to prepare & agree w/IDA, suitable bid docs for competitive selection & employment of contractors to carry out dist. sys.ins tallation & other works, & thereafter apply these sel. procedures.
EEPCo to prepare: (a) staffing program providing technical, commercial and other support to ensure adequate maintenance of thegridand (b) strategy to retain qualified and trained staff.
EEPCo will engage and maintain a Project Supervision engineering firm under terms of reference acceptable to IDA
EEPCo will maintain the UEAP Office with appropriate staffing as agreed with the Association, including environmental,procurement,accounting and monitoring and evaluation expertise.
ESMF and RPF will be implemented in a manner satisfactory to IDA.

comment.narrative: For a six month period during power rationing
